hackathon-description-text: Our hackathon theme is making a difference, with participants encouraged to engage with problems they see around them and devise a solution.
hackathon-rules:
All work submitted must be completed during the hackathon.
 
Teams can have no more than four members in them.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!
$250 of AWS credit for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Prize to be awarded for the best hack for the make a difference theme.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack under the StirHack Theme

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The prize awarded for the hack voted as the audience favourite.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=University of Stirling, Stirling FK9 4LA, UK

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Judging based on the theme of the hackathon.
The best hack as decided by Major League Hacking
The best use of domain.com as decided by Major League Hacking
Best use of AWS as decided by Major League Hacking
The best hack working against online harassment as decided by Major League Hacking.
The highest score to complete the Capture the Flag challenge hosted by Dogfi.sh

hackathon-location-address: University of Stirling, Stirling FK9 4LA, UK
